intro: Galium stojanovii var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are small, dry capsules. This variety is distinguished by its intermediate morphological traits between the typical forms of G. stojanovii.
